description.summary: home screen visibility protocol for layer surfaces

protocol.description:
This protocol allows layer-shell clients to control their visibility based on whether the compositor is in "home" mode or not.
Home mode represents the state where no regular toplevel windows are visible - similar to the iOS home screen. Layer surfaces can register as "home only" to be visible only in this state, or remain "always visible" (the default) like a top panel or dock.
The compositor controls when home mode is active, typically: - Entering home mode when Super key is pressed (minimizes all windows) - Leaving home mode when a window is activated or restored

interface.name: zcosmic_home_visibility_manager_v1
interface.description: This interface allows layer-shell clients to register for home visibility control and receive home state change events.

request.name: get_home_visibility

description.summary: get home visibility controller for a layer surface

request.description:
Create a home visibility controller for the given wl_surface. The surface must be a layer-shell surface (zwlr_layer_surface_v1).
By default, layer surfaces are "always visible". Use the controller to set them as "home only" if they should only appear when the compositor is in home mode.

event.name: home_state
event.description:
Sent when the compositor enters or leaves home mode. Also sent immediately after binding to provide the initial state.
Clients can use this to adjust their UI, for example showing different content when at home vs when windows are visible.

interface.name: zcosmic_home_visibility_v1

description.summary: home visibility controller for a layer surface

interface.description: This interface controls whether a layer surface is visible only when the compositor is in home mode, or always visible.

enum.name: visibility_mode

description.summary: visibility mode for the layer surface

enum.description: Defines when the layer surface should be visible.

entry.name: hide_on_home
entry.summary: hidden when at home (inverse of home_only)

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy this home visibility controller. The surface reverts to "always visible" behavior.

request.name: set_visibility_mode
request.description:
Set when this layer surface should be visible.
- always (0): Surface is always visible regardless of home state - home_only (1): Surface is only visible when compositor is in home mode - hide_on_home (2): Surface is hidden when in home mode (inverse fade)
The default is "always" to maintain backwards compatibility with existing layer-shell clients.
